oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: "Part Time Diary of R. [Reba] L. Howard in World War I"
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Loose-leaf black binder filled with notes of Howard's WW I experiences. It commences September 4, 1918, when he reports to the Chattanooga draft board, although he was from Henagar, Alabama. His assignment was as a cook in the 57th Pioneer Inf. Regt. From Camp Merritt, N.J., they sailed past the Statue of Liberty and then to France. Many soldiers were sick with influenza. Howard includes a list of full-pack equipment and writes of the Armistice and feeling hunger for the first time.
